website_summaries.verdict: A high-quality machine at an entry-level price, making it a great budget deal.
pros: Favored by parents of infants and children

customer_reviews.title: Irritating instead of Soothing
customer_reviews.text: This is truly an awful item. The sound can be loud if you want it, but the sound is horrible. Wanted this for rainfall, thunderstorms and ocean waves. In each, there is a strange and obvious sound you can hear and you hear it ever 30 seconds and it's irritating instead of soothing. This item has a 30 second loop on sounds and it kept me awake instead of put me to sleep. Returned today. Have had another model in the past and it broke down after several years of use. I'll go back to that other brand as it was so much better.
customer_reviews.author: JAC

customer_reviews.title: Overall the one that is working is fine and that one has been dropped a few times ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in two different years. The first one purchased in 2014 is still working today (5/2016). I purchased the second one in 2015 and it completely stopped working within 3 months. I never dropped it or got it wet it just stopped working. Overall the one that is working is fine and that one has been dropped a few times and handled by the baby. We always plug ours in but yes you can use batteries. Volume gets pretty loud and it does have a timer. I primarily select the white noise and that is perfect but the other sounds are just as good.
customer_reviews.author: NMS28

customer_reviews.title: Great machine & great value!!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using this exact machine for 10+ years. It was life/marriage saving for us. I love the volume level because we like it loud due to having puppies nails on our hardwood floors. I can only speak about the white noise & let me tell you...it is the bomb!! I will never be without my sound machine. I know there are hundreds out there but this one is perfect. You don’t need to spend $100. Great value!! We have one for home, our vacation home & one for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Sabra T.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great sound!
customer_reviews.text: I've gotten 4 of these, as I use them for my kids white noise at night. They've been dropped a few times - although the last time one of them broke. All in all, good quality and easy to use. The sounds seem to be on fairly short repeat, though we only use the white noise sound (which has a lot of sound together). We keep buying these because they are easy to use, can be loud, and are easy to transport. We have only periodically used the battery option.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Marlin

customer_reviews.title: Thanks for a good night's sleep!
customer_reviews.text: This is a real boon to us in the winter. In the summer, the hum of the fan and the outside insect noises provide good sleeping background. It's very quiet in our bedroom in the winter, save for the noises made by our three doggies, which can be very distracting. I just crank up the "summer night" sound and all is well. This is the second of this model that I've owned (first was from a buddy who'd picked it up at a thrift shop - it worked fine for me for a couple of years and finally gave up the ghost) and I'm really happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Good Brother Cadfael

customer_reviews.title: Not something I would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: Too much static, I have to move it around so that it doesn’t pick up static from other electronics. I have not used it fir traveling, but knowing what I know about the static, I would not travel with it. The loop can become monotonous. I am a light sleeper...the reason I need a sleep machine. The loop noise can become very noticeable and will actually be nerve racking on certain sounds. This was inexpensive so...I guess it speaks fir itself...ya get what ya pay for!
customer_reviews.author: firefly

customer_reviews.title: This was the second machine I have purchased. The ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the second machine I have purchased. The first one works okay. This one stopped working just past amazons thirty day return policy. The various noises were not being emitted, and the machine would turn off on its own, and it was difficult to turn on. Sometimes I would have to push the power button four or five times to get it on. Then it stopped working all together. It's a shame because it has all the features I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully Amazon has a great return/refund policy. We have a camp in the Adirondacks that doesn't have power. I need a fan in order to sleep. Otherwise it takes me forever to fall asleep and I sleep very lightly. I figured a battery operated sound machine would be great. Twice in the middle of the night the machine went from the "waterfall" sound to straight static that was so loud I sat straight up in bed. It was terrible! I had to turn it off! I am now looking for another one.... The pros are there are 10 different sounds and a timer! I wish it had worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia L. Smith

customer_reviews.title: great product great price
customer_reviews.text: This machine has all the settings you would want in something like this. It has a volume control that goes very loud or very quiet. My favourite feature besides all the different sounds is the option to shut off the automatic shut off switch. I needed one stay on all night for my daughter and so many of them do not offer this option. Before committing to one, see that it has the option to shut off the timer. It makes all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: andrews

customer_reviews.title: Did not like at all
customer_reviews.text: Bought for husband he travels a lot and doesn’t sleep good when he is gone he picked this out but most of the sounds were not different from the others horrible speaker sounds worse than tin cans gave to grandkids to play with thats the two star they love it they are two and three
customer_reviews.author: Theresa L

customer_reviews.title: SOUNDS GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The unit has some plus points...one of which is perfect for a sleep aid...it stays on until you turn it off...way better than a 60 minute CD...and it has several choices of sounds that are known for helping induce sleep. However...the unit has, a couple times now, fluttered a little like the sound was breaking up. For the most part though this little machine does a very good job. It's easy to operate and doesn't take up much room at all. I really won't be able to tell how it's doing until we've had it for a year. Overall I would say it's easily a B+ with an A potential
customer_reviews.author: PROUD GRAMPA

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Helps my baby sleep at night. Been using it every night for going on six months and it's still going strong. I love that it has both battery and cord power. No complaints! ETA: We've now been using this for two years, all night, every night, and it still works great. The cord does seem to have a break in it somewhere, but as long as it's sitting in one place, it works great. With how cheaply things are made nowadays, I'm amazed this is still holding up so well.
customer_reviews.author: bibliophile22Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: It works but is low quality
customer_reviews.text: I am a therapist and use this to mitigate noise outside my door. It gets loud which is nice. It has several settings but the sound quality is pretty poor and it sounds like a "bad recording." I've used it for a year now, and I've noticed a "pulsing" noise that occurs behind the regular white noise. It's almost like a record skipping behind the white noise sound. I think it's just from the poor quality of it - but I'm not sure. Maybe after a year it just wears out?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy together with something that WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for 3 months. Now it randomly stops. Have tried using it with batteries and with cable, it stills keeps turning off somewhere in the first few minutes after I turn it on. And now I can't return it anymore. Bad customer service. No one to talk to. I can't get a refund. I'll need to buy a new one. So if you're considering buying this product I suggest you buy another one that WORKS at the same time so at least you have a noise machine.
customer_reviews.author: Sruly614

customer_reviews.title: Can't sleep very much with this.
customer_reviews.text: Not the sound I'm looking for. The sounds are kind of hollow and "low definition" like a 1980's microphone was used to record the sound and then played them back on AM radio from a cassette tape. As another review mentions there's even a slight underlying repeating sound that you hear most of the time that's annoying and not soothing. I end up focusing on the repeating tick more than anything else. Going to try a different brand. I bought this one because I thought I wanted more sounds to choose from, but the birds and night sounds are more annoying than I need.
customer_reviews.author: I Really Bought This

customer_reviews.title: Best Sound Machine
customer_reviews.text: This is THE ONLY white noise machine I ever recommend to new parents. It has a nice choice of sounds and volume. My favorite feature is that it can be plugged in or it can run on batteries, which means you can take it in the car for long trips! This feature is the reason my sleeping baby made it through a two hour traffic jam while traveling for vacation! I personally own 6!
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy again kids but not against lightning
customer_reviews.text: Survived five years of being knocked around by my kids. When it did finally conk out, we bought a different, more expensive machine that didn't last 6 months, so we bought another of these and it's still kicking. Edit: a few days after I posted this, we had a lightning storm, and lightning struck nearby but didn't hit our house directly. My cable modem and this thing died, it may need better internal insulation.
customer_reviews.author: S. Turpin

customer_reviews.title: Sleep, baby. Sleep.
customer_reviews.text: We already had this exact sound machine for our 2 y/o, so we ought it again for he baby. We love that you can turn the timer off, adjust the volume on a sliding scale, and choose from a variety of sounds. Tip: if you forget to turn it on and need to sneak into a sleeping baby's room to turn it on, spin the wheel to the lowest volume setting before turning it on. Then you can gradually increase volume instead of blasting the sound suddenly.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth S. Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Fair enough for the money
customer_reviews.text: The item is somewhat flimsy and not terribly well made. The volume control doesn't really have a middle ground, going from fairly quiet to pretty loud. A few of the recorded sounds have a glitchy noise when the sound loops, which keeps me awake, so I don't use those sounds. Overall, with noisy neighbors, it gets the job done. I'd recommend and buy again. If you're fussy about the quality of sound and mid-range volume, go for a more expensive model. I'm content with this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Geri

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This noise machine has been very helpful in helping my baby sleep more soundly. My only gripe with it is that sometimes the volume button is a bit hard to control and is a little inconsistent. If you found my review helpful, please let Amazon know by hitting the "helpful" button.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Good product to help those who are light sleepers.
customer_reviews.text: Helps me sleep by using the white noise setting. As a result I don't hear the street sounds in the neighborhood. It also diminishes the sound of one who snores a bit. It even came with an AC adaptor so that batteries are optional. This replaces another, same model, where batteries don't work anymore, (fresh ones that is). The old one lasted in excess of 5 yrs and malfunction concerning the batteries occurred after if was lent to someone else for a while.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I really loved this machine it first
customer_reviews.text: I really loved this machine it first. We bought it for our daughter to use. She sleeps really well with some kind of white noise. She has used it for the last year during naptime and bedtime. I guess it's perhaps a little too much to hope for, but after A year the machine will turn off intermittently. My only complaint is that this thing didn't last more than a year. I know that we use it every day for minimum eight hours, but I feel like that's not a whole lot to ask when you are looking for a noise machine. I am now shopping for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: audkat

customer_reviews.title: Best sound machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver for those who are light sleepers. My baby used to wake up from even the slightest of nioses and I would go nuts. A family friend recommended this sound machine and let me tell you..It does the job! We even bring this along for when we travel.This product is must for those who are light sleepers and need there sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: HELPS WITH INSOMNIA
customer_reviews.text: I like the Ocean Waves setting, but there are a total of 10 different sounds. It has help me very much with chronic insomnia in getting to sleep and helping me to go back to sleep in the middle of the night should I wake up.
customer_reviews.author: Brookview Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies, kids and adults
customer_reviews.text: I use this for when I give massages and love the different sounds. This is what got my 6 month old to start sleeping in his crib. He is 6 and still uses it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Mine has a name, they're amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I can't sleep without my "soundy." I set it to the ocean and fall asleep on the waves. It's amazing for blocking out snoring spouses, and sounds of traffic or loud neighbors. And it's addictive. Once you have one, you'll need another for traveling. They're amazing and their sounds are so real. Fall asleep with the ocean tonight, a "Soundy" of your own is waiting, just one click away.
customer_reviews.author: E&E0715Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed-funky sounding after less than 20 uses
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed. I got this to use when we travel, as it has a battery option. But we've been using it less than a year, and in that time maybe actually only used 20 times at most. All the sounds are starting to sound funky, even when plugged in. I've been noticing them getting more computerized sounding lately, but right now, it just sounds like weird static. Not pleased or impressed and would never recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: banannie44

customer_reviews.title: Complete junk!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to get this product. Once I set it up and began playing the ocean waves there would occasionally be a obnoxious distortion of sound (that would be enough to wake me from sleep) so I contacted Amazon and a replacement was sent. I received the replacement only to discover the distortion was much more prominent in that one. I have returned for a refund. Save yourself time and effort, just buy a different model. This one is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya L. Klanert

customer_reviews.title: ... have a crazy freak of a dog who gets easily startled at everything when we stay in hotels (which ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a crazy freak of a dog who gets easily startled at everything when we stay in hotels (which we do quite often). I was struggling with how to handle the situation and came across this - it has been a lifesaver!!! I love that it's battery operated so I can use it anywhere. I bought a couple of them so I always have a back up. It also works well with my dog who's afraid of thunderstorms - I just put this on and it masks the thunder enough so she's able to relax.
customer_reviews.author: StefD

customer_reviews.title: she turns it on and goes back to sleep easily.
customer_reviews.text: This product helped my daughter fall asleep and stay in bed. Once we moved to our new house my 7 year old had a difficult time staying in bed. The loud air conditioner and outside noises woke her up and she just couldn't go back to sleep. Which meant I was then awakened by her. This machine helped her to relax and stay in bed. It lulled her back to sleep. Now we don't turn it on at night anymore. BUT on the off chance that she can't self-soothe when she wakes up, she turns it on and goes back to sleep easily.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Product has dysfunctional speakers or sonething.
customer_reviews.text: This product was great the first night. The volume was a little annoying (a little too loud or a little too quiet) but I could ignore it. I was happy with the simple use and sound options. Second night I felt like chucking it across the room. I nearly got to sleep and it suddenly started making a loud dying radio kind of noise. I fiddled with it and it went away just long enough to nearly fall asleep again. A couple more times and I just turned it off. I can sleep better with the loud ringing in my ears. -.-
customer_reviews.author: Jesse E Bowlen

customer_reviews.title: Another "You Get What You Pay For" Product
customer_reviews.text: I had a mechanical version of this about 40 years ago...made a quiet "white noise" sound and was adjustable for tone. After getting this one on a promotional Christmas "deal", I was disappointed when I turned this one on. The "white noise" ,as well as the other sounds, all have a distinct background sound that is a rythmic pattern that repeats over and over again...sounds like someone driving a pylon into the ground at a distance of 2 blocks away! It's even noticable at lower volume...probably from a defect in the electronics. I would have been saved myself money if I had just tuned my radio off-station and listened to the static!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound- quality
customer_reviews.text: It has several options for listening... yet the sound is broken up and choppy. Can’t sleep or enjoy it. I bought several. Kept two for ourselves- gifted others. Tried first one... thought hmmm... must be unit. Tried second one- same noise/sound breaks and interruptions.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M.

customer_reviews.title: compuiterized noise and quick repeats.
customer_reviews.text: I can tell its computerized noise. so far i've closely listened to 4 of the settings and have noticed a 6 to 10 second repeat. the only thing i like about this product is the easy to use volume the raised settings, raised off button and overall price. So if you dont mind hearing the exact same sound repeated every few seconds then youll like this product. I have about 12 cds with actual sounds that are recorded on this unit, there really is a big difference from the real thing, someone should put those on flash drive and incorporate it into this simple device then you'd have the perfect machine.
customer_reviews.author: jamie

customer_reviews.title: Terrible noise machine with crackling speaker and sound problems
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my newborn daughter before she arrived and had it opened and in her room, ready to go when she was born. The first night while it was playing the waterfall sound it began crackling loudly like a machine gun and woke everyone up. The next night we decided we would try the white noise sound and it had what sounded like a horn that would beep every 15-30 seconds. I would've returned this but since I bought it and opened it before she was born I was out of the time frame. Maybe mine is defective or maybe they are all this bad. Would not recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crowder

customer_reviews.title: Great for baby!
customer_reviews.text: We have had one of these in each of our kids’ rooms since they were newborns. The white noise is perfect, drowns our background noise, and helps signal to them that it is “time to sleep”. I love that this machine allows you to keep the sound on all night. Runs in batteries (great for travel) or a plug-in cord (included). Way cheaper than the sound machines that are marketed specifically for babies.
customer_reviews.author: LCP06

customer_reviews.title: Love the white noise sound on this machine
customer_reviews.text: Love the white noise sound on this machine. Have to make sure to keep my cell phone a couple of feet away from it at night as it interferes with the sound (they all do that though). The red power light on the top is too bright for me, so I just sit a small stuffed animal on top of it and it covers the light and also muffles the sound a bit which is perfect. I use this machine every single night. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: lzdubmaster

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for nursery!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our nursery and are overall very happy with this purchase. We use it only on the white noise setting and we are able to turn it up quite loud. Our infant sleeps much better with this on.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: after a few months of much use it started acting funny. We have to keep unplugging and plugging it ...
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Adjustable volume level, different sounds to choose from, wall plug-in AND battery operated, timer on or off (timer lasts for 1 hour). Cons: after a few months of much use it started acting funny. We have to keep unplugging and plugging it back in for it to turn on. After almost 2 years of every night and some days of use I think it's time for a new one. Because it is so versatile and the price is great I am getting the same one again. I gave it 3 stars b/c of a few times that I'm holding a baby and have to reach down and unplug and plug it back in to turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sounds tinny.
customer_reviews.text: It's loud but the sound quality is very low. I would describe it as tinny. The whole build quality is what you might expect from such a bargain device. And yet, it works. My two year old falls asleep and noises from outside his room are masked. I previously had the Homecics machine which had a better build quality and better sound but the volume switch went on the fritz almost instantly and took about a year to finally die. Hence I tried this model.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: This is our 4th. LOVE them.
customer_reviews.text: We've owned 3 of these. This will be our fourth. The first one died after about 10 years. We took that one on all overnight trips. My daughter took the 2nd when she moved out. The 3rd is still working, but we want one for travel and one for home. We only use white noise, but our favorite thing about this particular sound machine is the volume. It goes as loud as you need or as low as you want it to be, depending on how loud your partner snores or how noisey your neighbors might be.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Carver

customer_reviews.title: Meh, might work for some people.
customer_reviews.text: After listening to all the different sounds they had I found that all but one of them (the heartbeat one, which creeps me out) was clearly a 2 or 3 second looped track with a small change in sound when it loops back to the beginning, like a pop noise or little digital hiccup. This may not bother some people but once I hear that noise at the end/beginning of the loop that's all I can focus on every 2 or 3 seconds, which keeps me up and defeats the purpose of the machine, guess these things aren't for everybody.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: A Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This sound machine was recommended to me by my girlfriend, who also has one. I have used it for the last two nights, and some during the day, and so far I love it. I haven't noticed any of the problems mentioned by other reviewers, and I think the sounds are quite realistic. I, like her, use the ocean waves at night, and I think the running stream or the rainfall would be nice to drown out background noise while I am reading. I would say that this sound machine is probably at least one of the best ones for under $25.00, maybe the best, and I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve M.

customer_reviews.title: Use this as a noise machine for kids room. ...
customer_reviews.text: Use this as a noise machine for kids room. This is the 2nd one we have gotten since the wire does seem cheaper, and it simply just doesnt work after a while. But for this price, its ok to have to replace it every so often
customer_reviews.author: barb

customer_reviews.title: Must have for the newborn.
customer_reviews.text: Works grat. Battery back up is great. Easy on off. Easy volume control. Went to buy a second for second son. Sold out. Went to a different brand. Very unhappy with other brand. Buy this one and be done with it. You will sleep better at night because they will.
customer_reviews.author: drrx07

customer_reviews.title: Music sounded tinny - not as good as other machines
customer_reviews.text: Our baby loves rain and this had only one rain setting and it sounded tinny - not as good sounding as another machine purchased. It may work for you but my audiophile husband couldn’t do it.
customer_reviews.author: LBF

customer_reviews.title: We had tried everything except for this and I am so glad I bought this machine
customer_reviews.text: I really thought there was NO remedy for my husband's snoring. I seriously haven't slept a full night's sleep in over ten years. We had tried everything except for this and I am so glad I bought this machine. Thank you for making this machine. The white noise sound distracts my mind away from his snoring when I have it louder than the hubby. THANK YOU!
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these. The first two have been great, and worked wonderfully. Both are over 4 years old! So of course this summer when I was pregnant I decided to get a third for my baby. Well, it sucks. The middle button doesn't work so the noise either won't turn on, or it turns off after 5-10 minutes. I contacted the company, and never heard back.
customer_reviews.author: Rae Rae

customer_reviews.title: Condition not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Bought as used and reconditioned, quality very good. I beg to differ, 2 of the buttons make the same sounds and one cannot be pushed in to hear it. Bad, Amazon. Only kept it to cover the leaky shower stall.
customer_reviews.author: pjones

customer_reviews.title: Gets Loud, Poor audio quality, sounds are annoying
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is not that great. It sounds like a poor quality speaker. The sounds are also kind of annoying and lacked variation. The volume does go high.
customer_reviews.author: HoneyBee89

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Loud
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for 5 years with all three of my children. It is durable, simple, and LOUD. It definitely does a great job of blocking out the daily noise from my 4 and 5 year olds while the baby is napping. It does have a "loop" and can sound a little scratchy (not a smooth sounding as the dohm machine) but my children don't seem to mind that and are all great sleepers with this helping them!
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Buying one for my 3rd baby right now
customer_reviews.text: I received this as a gift for my first daughter, and it helped tremendously in the sleep department. I used it from the start and It became a sleep cue for her. She knew it was bedtime when I turned it on. It lasted about two years, and we used it every night and every nap. I bought the same one for my next child, and she still use it. I am buying a new one for my next baby. There are so many pricier ones that it seems like maybe this one won't be good enough, but we have had wonderful experiences with all of the ones we have bought. These are a staple in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and the sound quality was VERY poor so I sent it back but I had to pay $5.99 for return shipping. It is in a plastic body and that's just how it sounds. Don't buy this for soothing sounds to help you sleep because it isn't soothing at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is by far the best one I've purchased
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a number of sound machines over the years for babies and kids. This is by far the best one I've purchased. My parents and friends with kids have also loved this sound machine vs. others they have used. I'm currently ordering two more for my kids since I took them to Europe and was heartbroken when they were fried when plugged in with an adaptor. Very sad day.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Best one we found
customer_reviews.text: We use these on the "white noise" setting for our kids while sleeping. It helps put them and keep them in a deep sleep, regardless of how busy it is in the house. It runs on batteries, so can be taken on trips or even camping, or have backup power supply in case of power outage. I appreciate how loud they go, that they're not bulky, have the option for continuous play or automatic shut off. we have found it helps us as parents sleep better too, as small noise inconsistencies in our environment no longer disturb us.
customer_reviews.author: Cup'o'java

customer_reviews.title: WArning, ours started smoking.
customer_reviews.text: To be fair, I’ve had this one for 4 years and loved it so much, I bought another for our other daughters room. However, yesterday I noticed it unplugged while cleaning up the room. I plugged it back in to test it. It didn’t make any noise, and a terrible smell and then smoke started. I’m so lucky that happened while I stood there and not in the middle of the night when the kids were sleeping.
customer_reviews.author: Karen-NJ

customer_reviews.title: seems to make newborns sleep better, is easily portable for naps at grandma's
customer_reviews.text: From a mom of four under 7 yrs.....I will never be without this machine as long as we have children. It helps babies stay sleeping through the constant noise of siblings, seems to make newborns sleep better, is easily portable for naps at grandma's, and this brand is much more durable than the Homedics one we used to use. I really only use the white nouse feature for the kids. As an adult I think it would be irritating, the nature sounds don't sound very realistic. But for my purposes it is a wonderful affordable device.
customer_reviews.author: abbaloosa

customer_reviews.title: Great little sound machine for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have very high expectations for this sound machine, given its low cost when compared to others. However, I've been pleasantly surpirsed with it so far. Its small and sleek design is great, and the volume roller switch is easy to use when you're half asleep and want to turn it up or down. There are a variety of sounds that are similar to "white noise", which are the types of sounds that I find most soothing. Another review mentioned a repetitive clicking sound that could be heard when sleeping on one side. I've encountered the same issue, but it's only on some of the sound types. Overall, still a great little machine that's well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Liz G.

customer_reviews.title: Louder volume range, good quality, battery or plug
customer_reviews.text: Can turn up louder than a lot of sound machines, great quality. We pack it in our suitcases for travel and it’s never broken. Can remove cord and run on battery - great for putting baby to sleep in stroller.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Ew. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I went through two of the same machine and both times it ended up with this odd sound that would randomly blurt out after playing the soothing sounds for any number of minutes. Sometimes it came after an hour, sometimes after a half hour. Sometimes it wasn't too loud, but sometimes it was so loud it easily woke up my husband, myself, and our few-week old baby in his bassinet. I returned the first and got a second; when it did the same thing I decided I was done with this little device. Not worth it. Find something else.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Swingle

customer_reviews.title: Keep it in my birds aviary and play for them ...
customer_reviews.text: Keep it in my birds aviary and play for them when I'm at work. They have gotten so used to the sounds, when I start to leave without putting it on, they all chirp very loud to let me know I forgot something.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Does what I wanted it to do, and does it well
customer_reviews.text: I really love this item. Enough choices provided for the sound for me. I particularly like to use the timer function so I can set it when I go to sleep and it will turn itself off. Note: The timer is set at 60 minutes; haven't found any other option on this model for using the timer. Also note: Even tho' I am a Prime customer, it not only routinely takes extra days to get the item (it was so stated when I ordered) but it then took even more time than predicted. Ended up getting it over a week later, I believe.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Nice and loud
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my son to replace the fan we had been using for white noise. Pros: Good sound selection, so there are options for finding something that will lull your kid. It gets very loud! Can run on battery power as well as be plugged in. Cons: On some of the sounds you can hear the cycle, which annoys me but I doubt that my son cares much at all. The machine FEELS cheap. It is very light plastic and doesn't feel very durable. We have had it a little while now and it is holding up well but I am wary.
customer_reviews.author: Arkanskers

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money & horrible quality of sound!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this machine, but I just don't! I took a gamble purchasing it, as there are so many different reviews. I tried every single sound and they all annoyed me. I liked the waterfall, but there is a background faint ringing sound and the loop of noise is really short. I can tell when it changes, as I am laying there awake. I wanted to like the rain one too but there are faint background noises in it as well. White noise works okay, but it's a waste to buy this if I can use a fan!!! Disappointed in this machine and it's harsh annoying sounds! Won't purchase this again or recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jae

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time!
customer_reviews.text: Horrible. Read a lot of reviews about sound quality being bad but all I wanted was the white noise and everyone seemed to think that part was ok. Bought it for our toddler's bedroom to drown out household noise. Had been using a fan but room got too cold. Short story short...had it less than a week and the thing would turn off and turn on randomly. I made sure it wasn't set on the timer. It was plugged in to the wall outlet so this was no "bad batteries" case. So annoying. When I called in they said they had a lot of people calling for the same problem. Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.author: LadyB

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: This "noise maker" as we refer to it has several sound options and a fine-tuned volume control that allows you to find the perfect volume for you (we have an older noise maker from a different manufacturer, where you basically get whisper quiet or screaming loud, even when you try to turn the knob to an in-between setting). I was very happy to see that the power light shuts off completely when the machine is turned off (many other machines have the light stay on just to show that the machine is plugged in).
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Spend some more & get a higher quality sound machine.
customer_reviews.text: I guess you get what you pay for. Pretty poor quality sound, to say the least! I bought this one because it works with regular batteries to use when we go camping, but compared to my much higher priced & exceptional quality one at home, this one is pretty sad.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly K.

customer_reviews.title: Sound machine
customer_reviews.text: This helps to counteract the popping noise from my upstairs neighbor. It keeps me from getting startled whenever they "pop" their floor in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Julia

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!! 3 1/2 years
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME!! 3 1/2 years!! my husband works 3rd shift so a noise machine was a must have. Many I found shut off after an hour but this was one of the few that stayed on all night. I am not exagerating when I say that we have used this EVERY night for the past 3 1/2 years & it still works the same as it did when we first putchased.
customer_reviews.author: Gayle Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Pretty straight forward
customer_reviews.text: Pretty straight forward. A sound machine with several different types of noises that plugs into the outlet. My kids prefer the white noise and I also use this same settings for my newborn photography. Love that the volume control is a dial and allows you to change it so easily... it is a little quirky in that it will seem to "jump" to the next volume higher or lower (as if there are actually preset volume options hidden underneath), but even still, it meets our needs. We've had it for about 6 months and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work after a few months
customer_reviews.text: This thing is terrible. I use this at night to sleep and all of a sudden it starts making a horrible cracking noise after a few hours. The sound is similar to trying to tune a radio to a station when drive through the mountains.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Handy and versatile white noise generator
customer_reviews.text: I needed a white noise generator for confidential conversations during mediations in my offices. The Conair comes with an A/C adaptor, but it can also run on 4 AA batteries. Battery power allows you to place it in locations where a power cord would be awkward. It has 10 different background sounds, and all seem pretty effective. The volume control is prominent and easy to use. If you want to use the Conair as a sleep aid, it has a 60 minute timer. I wish it came with a wall mount bracket; I ended up kludging together a door mount, but it's not quite elegant.
customer_reviews.author: wei

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected...
customer_reviews.text: This product was not what I expected at all. First off, it was really loud, even on the lowest volume setting. The sounds did not sound natural to me at all. I would not recommend this product as a sleep machine (the white noise setting was horrendous) or as an office product. (I work in a mental health setting and we often use white noise machines for privacy. I tried to take the cheap way out with this, which was a poor choice on my part.) The product itself seemed durable and well-made. It could be useful for theatrical purposes or for children. Regardless, I returned it the day after I received it.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Had for less than a month and the machine started making just a static noise and none of the actually noises. It will turn on and make the noise you set it to but after abut 20 mins it starts that static nose again. And it won’t turn off I have to unplug it...... I am confused because my mom and my sister both have one and never has this ever happened to them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for sleep
customer_reviews.text: If you're getting this to drown out conversation in an office, even a large one, this one may be for you. It has selection and volume to do the trick. If you plan to use it in a bedroom to help put noise spikes in the background so you can sleep, forget it. All of the white noise settings have a rhythmic "backbeat" that sounds like the unit is riding on a rocking chair there beside you. Its lowest volume setting is very sensitive and difficult to get low enough so that the sheer volume of it doesn't defeat its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry C

customer_reviews.title: Horrible item. Does the opposite of what you want.
customer_reviews.text: This worked ok when we first got it. When you set your phone next to it it picks up signals and garbles the noise. After time the sound just gets permanently garbled and the water based noises turn into a horrible erratic static white noise. The other sounds turn into this horror movie level background music. Sometimes the sounds start out nice and turn bad. Its get murdered in your sleep nightmare fuel stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: great noise maker
customer_reviews.text: We have a slightly more expensive version of this for my preschool ages girls and have used it since they were babies to help drown out the noises from outside when the windows are open, or just from us moving around the house while they sleep. We love it. When we recently had another baby, I knew we would want another one for his room. This version doesn't have a clock, but we never even use the clock anyway. And it has fewer noise options, but we only use 3 (waves, white noise or heart beat) and it has those. It uses batteries organ be plugged in. We love it too.
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great for White Noise!
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with this product. I bought it for a white noise maker and thought most of the other settings would be quite annoying. Though a couple of them are a little irritating, most of them are surprisingly good. I love the volume control feature when it comes to adjusting to large and small room sizes. I also like that it doesn't dry out the room like a fan (especially when kids are sick). I am curious to see how the Heart Beat setting works for my newborn in a few months. I think I am actually going to buy one or two more! Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.author: Kiralee Solmes

customer_reviews.title: Was great while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product as a sleep aid. I work night shift and I have to say the sound was great. It was truly helping to block the noise and allow me to achieve a better sleep. However, I am very disappointed in the quality. After using it for only two weeks of the speakers started to loudly crackle and buzz intermittently. The loud sound was waking me up. It seem to do it every few hours. Can't quite figure out why. It is now not worth using due to that issue. Although I did love the product while it was working I wish it was better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael W.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price.... not great
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to help me sleep during the day as I work nights... however it was not the right one for me. First off I could hear the "clicking" that occured every few seconds to restart the sound. And it drove me up the wall. But the thing that really did me in was the fact that whenever anyone would call my cell, or anyone in my buildings cell, the unit would make a horrible screaching noise... now i've had that with speakers, but I was not expecting it with a sound machine. Needless to say I was constantly being woken by a horrible screaching, so I returned it and gotinstead.
customer_reviews.author: Eustacia Vye

customer_reviews.title: not to bad
customer_reviews.text: A decent sound machine. Obviously you get what you pay for when it comes to stuff like this, so it's not gonna sound like a $150 machine but for the price it's not bad. I have noticed after continued use the sound quality gets a little worse and on some of the sounds it sounds like the machine skips in and out of sounds. Overall a decent product but would consider spending a little extra for something better.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: GOOD SOUND FOR BABY.
customer_reviews.text: Baby is now 10 months old, we've been using this since she was a week old. The sounds are great. When she was first born, the heartbeat sound calmed her down and soothed her; now she enjoys the rain, birds and brook sound. The heartbeat sound makes her cry now... go figure. The volume is adjustable and the sounds are clear. I just wish it had a timer for how long we can play the sound. It automatically shuts off around 40 minutes. Other than that tiny complaint, this is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: jam

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids and newborns
customer_reviews.text: I use this machine for my toddler to sleep with. I love it because it turns off after an hour so I don't have to listen to the white noise all night over the monitor. I also use it for my colicky newborn. The volume can be turned up very loud which is great when you need loud white noise to soothe. We only use the white noise setting but my son likes to listen to the others and they are soothing. Overall, perfect for children who need white noise and easy to use and small. I also like that you can turn it on and off and slide the volume easily.
customer_reviews.author: Slpmommy

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: The plusses: It's LOUD. So, so loud. Loud enough that when I turn on the monitor to my kids' room, I can hear it perfectly clearly. There are also many different options, which is nice. The minus: We've had this for just a few months, and it's already developed a very distinct and repetitive clicking noise. Fortunately my kids don't seem to mind, but it would annoy the heck out of me. If I had to buy again, I would look for a different machine.
customer_reviews.author: KBN in DC

customer_reviews.title: Can't reccomend this
customer_reviews.text: All the sound bits have a 'click' at the end of their loop. While trying to fall asleep I keep hearing it and it drives me nuts. And all the loops are < 4 seconds, so you hear it REALLY often. I mostly use the "white noise" setting, but it's in all of them. The two of these I have I bought 2 years ago (same model #, looks identical), so it's remotely possible they've improved it. Yes, I'm picky about these things :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Watt

customer_reviews.title: Irritating Sound Therapy
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this product, but it did not live up to its potential. The sounds of rainfall and rushing river are nice, but the other options are irritating or cartoonish at best. The point where the sounds loop are obvious and jarring rather than soothing, and much of the time the machine emits a high-pitched whine along with the sound effects that is so unpleasant, it makes impossible to sleep or relax. This product is not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Bellis

customer_reviews.title: Good, inexpensive sound machine
customer_reviews.text: This is our second sound machine. Has a nice variety of sounds and does the trick for our childrens rooms for sleeping. One we have had for a year and it's still going strong. Has a plug and battery option. We use the battery option when traveling
customer_reviews.author: kb

customer_reviews.title: Initially everything was fine, but after a month the adapter stopped fitting ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my infant as she's white noise dependent and my mom had it and it worked so well. Initially everything was fine, but after a month the adapter stopped fitting correctly (how is this possible?) and so any slight touch of the cord and it would come loose and lose power. SO annoying!! Now it doesn't work at all. I'm very disappointed. My mom's machine works beautifully so maybe it's just a defect with my specific one?
customer_reviews.author: Austin Young

customer_reviews.title: Second machine for second child
customer_reviews.text: We had bought an earlier model of this sound machine when my son was born, who still uses it. When my daughter was born earlier this year, we needed a second so that they both could use it. They machine are pretty simple and straightforward, doing pretty much exactly what you would expect.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Margolis

customer_reviews.title: What am I hearing, exactly?
customer_reviews.text: It works well years after I bought it but its a digital sound so there are weird backround sounds that repeat behind the noise thats playing. If you're sensitive to something like that I'd recommend just a simple white noise machine instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect sound therapy
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected, not much difference in sounds of rainfall, storm, or waves, but just enough and best part is volume and 1 hour automatic turn off. I keep this in office turn it on to stimulating sound when working and to calming sound when relaxing. It fits the bill perfectly, small yet loud enough
customer_reviews.author: LeeSFV

customer_reviews.title: Not great for sleepless adults
customer_reviews.text: This product would be great for kids/babies who need a bit of sound while sleeping. However, if you are an adult who has trouble sleeping, invest in one of the $40 machines on amazon. All sounds are on a 3 second loop, which becomes quite clear in the middle of the night when all else is quiet and all you can hear is the same sound being constantly replayed. If you fall right to sleep, this might work for you, but if not, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter who has ADHD and often has troubles sleeping, terrible night mares, etc.. Also, we have a smaller house and I hate trying to be quiet while she is sleeping. We both like the "Rain" noise the most, but all noises are great and very soothing. The volume button on it goes very very loud or all the way quiet which is awesome because I didn't expect it to go that loud! I can't wait to buy it for myself and my daughter is very thankful, takes it to paw paws house with her if she is spending the night!
customer_reviews.author: Sage

customer_reviews.title: Very loud!
customer_reviews.text: When the volume is all the way up, it's extremely loud! Great for noisy homes! The sounds are slightly different from the homedics brand, so if you have a kid used to a certain sound, I'd stick with the other. We only use the white noise.
customer_reviews.author: s.autrey

customer_reviews.title: Great for white noise
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment where there is always some noise going on making it difficult to sleep without some white noise in the back ground. I bought this for my son who loves to go to sleep to the sound of running water. Because the sound can be turned up or down, it very easily masks the other sounds coming from outside our apartment. The price was very reasonable but it was well worth the price for my son to get a good night's sleep every night since we first plugged it in!
customer_reviews.author: Kathikat

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable. Broken after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: This product is not reliable at all. It broke after 6 months of use. I called Con Air since it was still in warranty, but they require the old unit to be shipped back to them in order to get a new unit. I wasn't willing to pay $11 in shipping cost for a $16 item, so I guess I'm out of luck and will be buying a different brand of noise machine next time that will last more than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: JATess

customer_reviews.title: Volume control is great.
customer_reviews.text: Had one of these and they broke so I purchased this one and it works great. If you need a great nights sleep I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Goodner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and so loud
customer_reviews.text: I’m obsessed with this sound machine and recommend it to everyone with new babies. It gets SO LOUD which helps to drown out our older toddler so the baby can sleep. A whole bunch of different sounds but we use the white noise and bring it everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Hannah McBride

customer_reviews.title: Volume not as powerful over time.
customer_reviews.text: Initially we loved this sound machine! We purchased it in May and our newborn can’t go to sleep without it on. Within the last week though, the volume has become gradually less loud. It’s like it is dying... but it is plugged in so that doesn’t make any sense. It was still a good purchase at the time but we were definitely hoping it would last longer!
customer_reviews.author: B. hill

customer_reviews.title: lots of sounds to chooe from, high volume too
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my office for white noise but its funny to hear my visitors try to guess what sound They think their hearing. I like the bird/running brook setting. One guest thought it sounded like mice in a cage, the other thought it was a pipe with a small gas leak, the other thought it was a recording of people talking in a room. I hear it just fine...it sounds great but I don't use it very much now.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Husband

product_meta.title: Conair Sound Therapy Sound Machine
feature_bullets: Elemental therapy to soothe: sounds, rhythm, & nature

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
